item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Bill Maher
item.description: "The "Power of One" is a slogan--not a goal. " -- Bill Maher

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "He gave me a look sure to put frost on anyone's pumpkin." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "His heart danced upon her movements like a cork upon a tide. He heard what her eyes said to him from beneath their cowl and knew that in some dim past, whether in life or revery, he had heard their tale before." -- James Joyce

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "Our lives are defined by opportunities, even the ones we miss." -- Eric Roth

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Jeaniene Frost
item.description: "If I die, I will wait for you, do you understand? No matter how long. I will watch from beyond to make sure you live every year you have to its fullest, and then we’ll have so much to talk about when I see you again… (Bones)" -- Jeaniene Frost

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Sarah Ockler
item.description: "Weeping is not the same thing as crying. It takes your whole body to weep, and when it's over, you feel like you don't have any bones left to hold you up." -- Sarah Ockler

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "The phoenix must burn to emerge." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "we are imperfect mortal beings, aware of that mortality even as we push it away, failed by our very complication, so wired that when we mourn our losses we also mourn, for better or for worse, ourselves. as we were. as we are no longer. as we will one day not be at all." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Another thing I need to do, when I'm near the end of the book, is sleep in the same room with it...Somehow the book doesn't leave you when you're asleep right next to it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Vanish. Pass into nothingness: the Keats line that frightened her. Fade as the blue nights fade, go as the brightness goes. Go back into the blue. I myself placed her ashes in the wall. I myself saw the cathedral doors locked at six. I know what it is I am now experiencing. I know what the frailty is, I know what the fear is. The fear is not for what is lost. What is lost is already in the wall. What is lost is already behind the locked doors. The fear is for what is still to be lost. You may see nothing still to be lost. Yet there is no day in her life on which I do not see her." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "She hoped that although he could not hear her she could somehow imprint her ordinary love upon his memory through all eternity, hoped he would rise thinking of her, <i>we were each other, we were each other, not that it mattered much in the long run but what else mattered as much.</i>" -- Joan Didion

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "A true friend is the one who holds your hand and touches your heart" -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Her first reaction was one of hope, because his eyes were open and shining with a radiant light she had never seen there before. She prayed to God to give him at least a moment so that he would not go without knowing how much she had love him despite all their doubts, and she felt an irresistible longing to begin life with him over again so that they could say what they had left unsaid and do everything right that they had done badly in the past. But she had to give in to the intransigence of death. (Love in the Time of Cholera)" -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Laura Esquivel
item.description: "[Words] cling to the very core of our memories and lie there in silence until a new desire reawakens them and recharges them with loving energy. That is one of the qualities of love that moves me most, their capacity for transmitting love. Like water, words are a wonderful conductor of energy. And the most powerful, transforming energy is the energy of love." -- Laura Esquivel

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You're off to Great Places! Today is your day! Your mountain is waiting, So... get on your way!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Wiserblond add a quote by Eve 6
item.description: "Here is to the nights we felt alive, here is to the tears you knew youd cry, here is to good bye, tomorrow is going to come to soon." -- Eve 6
